intro: Leucopogon setiger, commonly known as the rough leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow, leathery, and covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open woodlands and heathlands.
